Elvis Oswaldo López Meza

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/2825038022641357
  • Última atualização do currículo em 15/08/2019

Bachelor in physics from Universidad Nacional de Trujillo (2003 - 2008) ? Perú, with erudition in Quantum Electrodynamics. Master (2008 - 2010) and Doctorate (2010 - 2014) in physics from Centro Brasileiro de Pesquisas Físicas working in biocompatible thin films and plasma processes. Extensive expertise in magnetron sputtering, diagnosis of cold plasmas, plasma processing and biomaterials as: calcium phosphates, hydroxyapatite and functionalized hydroxyapatite from ions substitutions. Besides, structural characterization techniques as: X-ray diffraction (also using Synchrotron radiation), X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), atomic force microscopy (AFM) and Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FTIR), and as also in instrumentation with technology of vacuum systems as well using SolidWorks and COMSOL Multiphysics software. Furthermore, other expertise in: s-SNOM (Infrared vibrational scattering scanning near-field optical microscopy), XRF (X-ray fluorescence), FIB (focused ion beam) and TEM (transmission electron microscopy) techniques. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Formação acadêmica/titulação
2010 - 2014
Doutorado em Física.
Centro Brasileiro de Pesquisas Físicas, CBPF, Brasil.
Título: INFLUENCE OF THE PLASMA PARAMETERS IN A RIGHT ANGLE MAGNETRON SPUTTERING (RAMS) IN THE CONTROL OF THE GROWTH OF THIN FILMS OF HYDROXYAPATITE WITH IONIC SUBSTITUTION FOR BIOMEDICAL APPLICATIONS., Ano de obtenção: 2014.
Orientador: Alexandre Malta Rossi.
Coorientador: Alexandre Mello de Paula Silva.
Bolsista do(a): Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior, CAPES, Brasil.
Palavras-chave: Plasma Processing; Crystalline Hydroxyapatite Thin Films; Crystalline Fluor-Hydroxyapatite Thin Films; Crystalline Zinc-Hydroxyapatite Thin Films; Crystalline Silicate-Hydroxyapatite Thin Films; Crystalline Carbonate-Hydroxyapatite Thin Films.
